instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Hi ive got an A1706 820-00239 that originally had a liquid spill back in Feb, i repaired the laptop and its still working :-) apart from the touchbar itself :-( , now first of all i thought maybe the touchbar itself got liquid a s well and just gave up so i replaced the touchbar but no luck , the touchbar dosnt show any signs of life that i can see, question is am i going to be trying to solve a problem im never going to get to the bottom off and messing up a fully working laptop (apart from touchbar) or do you think this is fixable, ive had a look at the schematics and im not too sure where to start or IF too at all, would welcome any feedback or if anyone else has had this issue too

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
Check for corrosion around J4401/02; post some voltages too.
Also check U4405/06...

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
Hi , no signs of corrosion, voltages for j4402 are:
1 = 0v
3=1.3v
5=0v
7=0v
9=1.8v
11=0v
13=0v
15-1.3v
17=0v
19=1.3v
21=0v

then pins:
2=0v
4=1.3v
6=0v
8=1.8v
10=1.4v
12=0v
14=0v
16=0v
18=0v
20=0v
22=5v

and on j4401, pins:

1=0v
3=0.7v
5=0.7v
7=0v
9=0.7v
11=0.7v
13=0v
15=0v
17=0v
19=0v
21=0v
23=0v
25=0v

on the other side pine:
2=0v
4=1.3v
6=1.3v
8=0v
10=1.4v
12=1.8v
14-0v
16=0v
18=3.3v
20=3.3v
22=3.3v
24=0v
26=0v

not sure if that points to anything but im lost :-)

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message:
You don't have P1V8_S0SW_DFR present.
I hope you checked with touchbar connected; let me know if true...

"18=3.3v
20=3.3v
22=3.3v"
Means DFR_DISP_PWR_EN and PP3V3_S5_T139 are both present.
In such case, P1V8_S0SW_DFR should be present too, coming out from U4404; any short there?

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Hi nope :-( i checked with it unconnected so i could check at the connection, im guessing this makes a difference ?

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Of course, not all signals, or voltages for touchbar will be enabled, if is not connected...

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: opps , do i need to measure them all again or just certain ones ?

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: Not really all; no need to measure ground pins ;)

threads.title: A1706 with no display on the touchbar
threads.message: oooh thanks :-) , just to make thing worse its not an 820-00239 its an 820-00923 which i cant seam to locate boardview or schematics, it looks the the 820-00239 do you know if i can use this one instead ???
